item.title: F1 title contender Oscar Piastri non-committal about helping Lando Norris win in Abu Dhabi
item.description: Oscar Piastri dodges the question of whether he might help Lando Norris lift the world F1 title in Abu Dhabi, saying McLaren has not discussed the issue.

item.title: What time is the F1 Abu Dhabi Grand Prix and how to watch Oscar Piastri in championship race
item.description: The Formula 1 world drivers' championship has gone down to the wire, with three drivers set to battle it out for glory at the season-finale Abu Dhabi Grand Prix.

item.title: Today in History, December 6: The day scientists found evidence of water on Mars
item.description: Scientists said at the time that the flow of water would have filled multiple swimming pools.

item.title: Oscar Piastri misses first practice at Abu Dhabi Grand Prix, finishes 11th in second session behind Lando Norris
item.description: Lando Norris makes the best start of the title contenders in practice at the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix as Oscar Piastri endures a disappointing day.

item.title: Oscar Piastri qualifies third for Abu Dhabi F1 Grand Prix, behind rivals Max Verstappen and Lando Norris
item.description: Oscar Piastri warns he's not out of the Formula One title hunt yet, even if many only now have eyes on a Lando Norris-Max Verstappen duel for the crown.

item.title: Concerns for the future of Canberra's public pools amid closures and redevelopments
item.description: As temperatures soar, advocates of public pools in Canberra say they want to see greater support and investment for facilities in the national capital.

item.title: Where Oscar Piastri lost the Formula 1 world championship, McLaren teammate Lando Norris claims ultimate prize
item.description: Oscar Piastri missed out on winning the Formula 1 drivers world championship by just 13 points to his teammate Lando Norris, the culmination of multiple small moments throughout the season that cost him dearly.

item.title: Oscar Piastri praised as future formula 1 world champion by rivals
item.description: Oscar Piastri's chief rival, new formula 1 world champion Lando Norris, says the Australian will "get the better of me" after their tension-filled title race decider in Abu Dhabi.

item.title: Rare brain illness could not stop Milly from making country netball history
item.description: A rare brain illness left Milly Brock unable to walk or speak, but eight months later, she was back leading her regional netball club on grand final day.

item.title: Trump's quietly released national security document didn't escape Europe's attention
item.description: When the White House quietly released its national security strategy late one night last week, it instead seemed to get lost in other news. Except, perhaps, in Europe.

item.title: Iron deficiency is a challenge for many female athletes, like Super Netball's Zara Walters
item.description: Zara Walters felt tired, dizzy and unable to recover from training sessions — then she found out she was low in iron. It's a condition that often goes undiagnosed, especially in female athletes.

item.title: ASIO examined Bondi Beach gunman Naveed Akram in 2019 for close ties to Islamic State cell
item.description: Australia's domestic intelligence agency, ASIO, examined one of the Bondi Beach gunmen six years ago for his close ties to a Sydney-based Islamic State terrorism cell, the ABC understands.

item.title: Bondi Beach shooting gunman Naveed Akram was follower of pro-Islamic State preacher Wisam Haddad
item.description: At least one of the gunmen who killed 15 people in Sunday's Bondi Beach terrorist attack was known to authorities as a follower of a notorious Sydney pro-Islamic State cleric, the ABC can reveal.

item.title: Farmers' Facebook group racks up 100,000 followers as they seek support across seasons
item.description: A group dedicated to Australian grain farming created more than a decade ago has just cracked 100,000 followers with about 20,000 people following from overseas.

item.title: Sisters in Sweat — the Sunday football session that grew a sporting movement of over 15,000 Indian women
item.description: Eight years ago, Swetha Subbiah was asked to run a single football session for a friend. She ended up starting a sporting movement, which now has 15,000 women and girls as members across Bengaluru, Mumbai, Hyderabad and Delhi.

item.title: Despite warnings from Donald Trump, the push for Israeli control over the West Bank continues
item.description: Despite US President Donald Trump's objections to the annexation of the West Bank, new settlement projects are approved, with some Israelis excited while Palestinians are left fearful.

item.title: Runner Nancy Dickman, 83, prepares for her next marathon at 90
item.description: Nancy Dickman has run marathons in London, New York, Rome and Sydney, and at 83 shows no signs of slowing down.

item.title: WA farming community loses 500 sheep, thousands of hectares of crops in fire
item.description: A bushfire emergency in Warradarge is over, but farmers say the work to recover what was lost has only just begun.

item.title: Swan Hill tobacco shop rammed in failed firebomb attempt as tobacco wars continue
item.description: A tobacco shop is rammed with a vehicle weeks after receiving a shakedown note demanding the owner "contact the commission".

item.title: Zohran Mamdani sworn in as NYC mayor with midnight subway oath
item.description: Zohran Mamdani is officially sworn in as major of New York City in a midnight, underground ceremony, with a more public affair to take place in hours time on the steps of City Hall.

item.title: Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro held in New York prison described as 'hell on earth'
item.description: The facility where detained Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro has been taken is a notorious New York jail that has held a string of high-profile and celebrity criminals, from drug cartel leaders to hip-hop stars.

item.title: Ousted Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro and wife Cilia Flores plead not guilty in New York court
item.description: Nicolás Maduro and Cilia Flores, who were captured in Caracas at the weekend, face multiple drugs and weapons charges.

item.title: Sixth man charged after livestock carrier allegedly used for cocaine drop in WA waters off Lancelin
item.description: A sixth man is charged over an alleged plot to import half a tonne of cocaine into Western Australia using an international livestock carrier.

item.title: Australia wins World Cross Country Championships relay gold after Jessica Hull's anchor leg
item.description: Olympic medallist Jessica Hull guides Australia home in the mixed relay event at the world titles in Florida.

item.title: Former A-League player Josh Cavallo alleges Adelaide United was homophobic
item.description: Australia's first openly gay male professional footballer, Josh Cavallo, has alleged his former club was homophobic, something it denies.

item.title: SpaceX capsule begins return to Earth from International Space Station with sick astronaut on board
item.description: The Crew Dragon capsule has undocked from the International Space Station carrying four astronauts, one of whom has a "serious medical condition", and is on its way back to Earth.

item.title: World champion Shelley Taylor-Smith runs swim group for women at Mettams Pool
item.description: They call themselves the "Sea Shells Teabaggers" — and with marathon swimmer Shelley Taylor-Smith at the helm, this ocean swim group has built something much stronger than good technique.

item.title: Sam Short's small leap to ocean swimming and the prospect of more Australian success in 2032
item.description: Sam Short will take on the country's best open water swimmers at the Australian Nationals this week, with a possible new event for Brisbane 2032 opening new opportunities for Australian gold.

item.title: Queensland Police seize firearms, drugs in Townsville bust
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Four arrested as Queensland Police seize guns, kilos of drugs in Townsville
item.description: Police find 100kg cannabis, 8kg of methamphetamine and 1kg of cocaine as well as illegal firearms hidden in bush at a Townsville property.

item.title: Crime gangs restocking shops 'up to 10 times a day' with illegal cigarettes and vapes, WA police say
item.description: WA's police commissioner says the restocking is happening faster than authorities can seize the products, as tobacco black market violence escalates.

item.title: Fiji police allegedly seize $780m cocaine shipment in drug operation targeting Pacific Ocean 'narco sub'
item.description: Fijian chiefs reported suspicious activity along their stretch of coastline to law enforcement agencies — which then swooped on an alleged $780 million drug operation.

item.title: To Lam wins second term to rule Vietnam through 2030
item.description: Vietnam's leader To Lam has been re-appointed as head of the ruling Communist Party for the next five years, and pledges to turbocharge growth in the export-reliant nation.

item.title: Majority of NSW beaches shut amid shark attacks to reopen for Australia Day long weekend
item.description: Heatwave conditions and Australia Day long weekend activities are expected to draw crowds back to the water after a dangerous 48 hours on the New South Wales coast.

item.title: A generation of activists like Grace Oo are taking up arms against Myanmar's military
item.description: As Myanmar's military junta seeks international legitimacy through elections, its brutal repression of the pro-democracy movement is radicalising a new generation of activists.

item.title: Woman discovers Holocaust descendants through DNA testing
item.description: Adriana Turk grew up believing there were no survivors on her Jewish father's side after World War II, but a DNA test showed that was not the case.

item.title: David Speirs sees 'pathway' to standing for election amid eligibility questions
item.description: Former South Australian Liberal leader David Speirs says there is a way he could stand for the upcoming state election — but is yet to declare whether he will — despite the electoral commission declaring he is ineligible.

item.title: Coalition chaos drags on ahead of first official sitting week
item.description: Former prime minister John Howard once observed that Pauline Hanson was an "electoral gift to the Labor Party". His words proved relevant this week as the Coalition's chaos dragged on.

item.title: Queensland farm cashing in on US wellness industry demand for camel milk
item.description: Camel milk is in hot demand in the wellness industry, now one Queensland farmer is seizing the moment.

item.title: Genetically modified purple tomatoes bound for fruit shops after regulator approval
item.description: The purple tomato was altered to make it taste better and boost nutrition.

item.title: Beckham saga is an age-old heartache with an uncomfortably modern twist
item.description: Cutting ties with your parents isn't a new phenomenon but having it painstakingly documented across social media is a contemporary problem.

item.title: Bruny Island to get childcare solution but too late for the Archers
item.description: After fighting for years for a childcare solution for her community, Teisha Archer says the news it will be happening is "wonderful" — but will come too late to help her and others in her situation.

item.title: Myanmar election won by military-backed party in widely condemned poll marred by violence
item.description: The military's political party wins the vote in a result regarded as a forgone conclusion, with critics arguing threats and violence forced people to the ballot box in a country wracked by civil war.

item.title: Inside the brand strategy behind the Beckham family drama — and who controls the narrative now
item.description: In a modern crisis, experts say control doesn't always come from speaking louder — but from knowing when, where and how briefly to speak at all.

item.title: Clive Palmer rejects Steve Bannon influence claim in latest Epstein files
item.description: Clive Palmer denies newly surfaced claims that his 2019 federal election campaign was influenced by a senior advisor to US President Donald Trump.

item.title: Novak Djokovic drops retirement hint, suggests 2026 could be his final Australian Open
item.description: Novak Djokovic did not go into detail on what he meant, nor did he confirm a plan to retire this year, but he chose his words carefully on centre court.

item.title: Novak Djokovic praises Carlos Alcaraz after Spaniard wins first Australian Open title
item.description: Despite the hollow feeling of defeat, 24-time major winner Novak Djokovic heaps praise on Carlos Alcaraz following the Spaniard's history-making Australian Open victory.

item.title: From Sabalenka to Djokovic and 'animals in the zoo', here are the best quotes from the Australian Open 2026
item.description: From tennis stars pushing for more privacy, to Djokovic saying he feels like an old man and a Kyrgios F-bomb, there have been some funny and weird quotes at this year's Australian Open.

item.title: Australia's Cam Myers becomes youngest ever winner of Wanamaker Mile indoor race in New York
item.description: Australia's Cam Myers becomes the youngest ever winner of the prestigious Wanamaker Mile, with the 19-year-old powering to victory in New York.

item.title: ACT election data suggests neither Liberal nor Greens voters would want a coalition between the parties
item.description: Greens voters overwhelmingly preference Labor over the Liberal Party across the country — and a look at the data from the 2024 ACT election suggests there's no reason to think that would be different in Canberra.

item.title: More children suffering serious injuries on e-scooters, study shows
item.description: Between 2021 and 2024, e-scooter injury-related admissions at Queensland Children's Hospital more than doubled, the study found, with young boys accounting for three-quarters of admissions, with a median age of 13.

item.title: Belinda Bencic and Elina Svitolina make history as two mothers sit in WTA top 10 for the first time
item.description: For the first time in women's tennis, two mothers are ranked inside the world's top 10 simultaneously.

item.title: Formula 1 driver Jack Doohan signs with Haas as reserve driver after leaving Alpine
item.description: Former Alpine racer Jack Doohan signed with Haas as a reserve driver for the 2026 Formula 1 season.

item.title: Greens link Hospitality Tasmania's donations to Liberals to pokies card demise
item.description: The Tasmanian Greens have accused the state's peak hospitality group and the Liberal Party of a "political stitch-up" to kill off the proposed mandatory pokies card, after hundreds of thousands of dollars in donations were revealed.

item.title: Diamonds eye timely glimpse of Jamaica in Test series ahead of Commonwealth Games
item.description: Australia's netballers expect to gain precious intelligence ahead of a showpiece tournament when they host Jamaica in a three-Test series.

item.title: Police lecture teen caught driving 189km/h on Sunshine Motorway at midnight
item.description: The teenager on his P-plates was pulled over by police along a Sunshine Coast motorway driving at almost 200km/h.

item.title: K'gari traditional owners hold smoking ceremony for Piper James on beach where she died
item.description: K'gari traditional owners have held a smoking ceremony for Piper James, who died on the island last month, to give her spirit a safe passage home.

item.title: Democrat victory in Republican stronghold could spell trouble for Trump
item.description: The US has been gripped by cold weather in recent weeks, but pundits say it is in Texas where hell has truly frozen over. A blue wave just swept a GOP stronghold, and Republicans are very worried.

item.title: Oscar Piastri defends McLaren and says he expects 'fair shot' at F1 title in 2026
item.description: Oscar Piastri insists the painful ending to his F1 title bid last season has only strengthened his resolve to be the "nice person" who brings the Formula 1 world drivers' crown back to Australia.

item.title: French authorities sink tonnes of cocaine bound for Australia, then release suspects
item.description: French authorities intercept a ship carrying five tonnes of cocaine bound for Australia, before releasing the vessel and its crew.

item.title: The easiest way to clean your microwave and a common mistake to avoid
item.description: When was the last time you cleaned your microwave? According to experts, it's actually a lot simpler than cleaning other appliances.

item.title: Golden bandicoot numbers triple at Newhaven Wildlife Sanctuary in Central Australia
item.description: A population of threatened golden bandicoots is booming at Newhaven Wildlife Sanctuary, north-west of Alice Springs.

item.title: Trump endorses Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi ahead of Japan's election
item.description: One of Sanae Takaichi's first engagements after she was elevated to prime minister in October was to host Donald Trump in Tokyo.

item.title: The moment turtle Terry was released from Sydney Harbour
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: How the Liberals will justify Sussan Ley's ousting
item.description: A permission structure has been crafted for Liberals to ditch the first woman to lead the federal party room before she has even had a year in the role.

item.title: After the uprising, Bangladesh returns to the ballot with its wounds still open
item.description: Bangladesh is heading back to the ballot box in what is being billed as its first free and fair election in more than a decade.

item.title: Heat and fires expose ancestral remains in Victoria's north-west
item.description: Ancestral remains that could be thousands of years old have been uncovered by erosion, dust storms and bushfires in Victoria.

item.title: Piper James's parents say dingo management reform needed to prevent further deaths on K'gari
item.description: Piper James's parents are leaving Australia with their daughter's ashes and a determination to ensure she hasn't died in vain.

item.title: One Nation capitalises on anti-immigration sentiment in a housing crisis
item.description: Pauline Hanson might not have any substantive policies, but her rhetoric about reducing migration is clearly finding an audience.

item.title: Japan PM Sanae Takaichi leads coalition to landslide election victory
item.description: Sanae Takaichi's Liberal Democratic Party and its coalition partner are expected to hold upwards of two-thirds of the seats in Japan's lower house.

item.title: Thailand PM Anutin Charnvirakul confident of forming government after election
item.description: South-East Asia's second-largest economy went to the polls on Sunday in a tight race between conservatives aligned with the military and the monarchy, and progressive elements represented by the reform-driven People's Party.

item.title: Kimberley cotton hits record high in first season with new processing gin in Kununurra
item.description: From farm to fabric, West Australian cotton growers are finally able to grow, process and export record amounts of cotton locally.

item.title: Mitchell Freeway head-on crash in Butler leaves two dead after ute driven on wrong side of road
item.description: A 56-year-old-woman and a 24-year-old man are dead after a head-on collision involving a utility that was being driven on the wrong side of the Mitchell Freeway in Perth's north.

item.title: Rain brings relief and road closures after record heatwave in South Australia
item.description: High rainfall in north-eastern South Australia brings some relief for pastoralists after record-breaking heat, with a reprieve expected for metropolitan Adelaide this week.

item.title: ASIO was told about Bondi shooter's terrorist links years before attack, former spy claims
item.description: The former undercover agent spied on the Akrams when he infiltrated a Sydney IS terror cell for Australia's intelligence agency.

item.title: 'Massive' Indonesian ghost barge washes up on tiny Torres Strait island
item.description: The barge drifted into Australian waters from Indonesia after breaking from its moorings during bad weather.

item.title: Roblox on notice after 'disturbing' reports of child grooming
item.description: The government puts popular social gaming site Roblox on notice following media reports of children being approached and groomed by predators on the platform.

item.title: Native title holders take appeal over one of Australia's largest groundwater licences to High Court
item.description: The cultural value of water will be front and centre in the High Court in Canberra today as a group of native title holders from Central Australia fight to assert cultural rights over an aquifer under their lands.

item.title: Surgeon Kelvin Kong's life growing up Chinese and Indigenous in Australia
item.description: Australia's first identified First Nations surgeon, Dr Kelvin Kong spoke about his Malaysian Chinese heritage during the annual Wang Gungwu lecture at Parliament House.

item.title: Race against bulldozers to save ancient grass trees in WA's South West
item.description: Some of WA's oldest grass trees are being rescued from land clearing and development amid a population and property boom, preserving a unique part of the South West's natural heritage.

item.title: 100kg of cocaine allegedly hidden in timber found at Lismore and Gold Coast
item.description: Police in NSW and Queensland say an alleged cross-border criminal syndicate intended to extract $14 million worth of cocaine from four tonnes of timber.

item.title: Formula 1 2026: New engines and no DRS headline major changes in grand prix
item.description: New engines, new regulations and an 11-team grid are just some of the changes in Formula 1 this season. Get up to speed with what is new in F1 ahead of the Australian Grand Prix.

item.title: Cryptosporidium cluster at Waterworld leads to closure of Adelaide Aquatic Centre pools
item.description: SA Health is urging people with gastroenteritis symptoms not to visit public swimming pools after eight cases at one swimming centre, including one child who was hospitalised and another who also visited the Adelaide Aquatic Centre.

item.title: Axed literary magazine Meanjin is resurrected by Queensland University of Technology
item.description: The 85-year-old literary journal Meanjin will return to Brisbane, where it was first published, after it was controversially closed by Melbourne University Press last year.

item.title: Bondi: Path to Terror
item.description: Four Corners is the home of Australian investigative journalism.

item.title: Australian fans miss out on World Cup tickets as prices skyrocket
item.description: A host of Australian fans will be denied the chance to watch the Socceroos World Cup campaign amid accusations of price gouging by FIFA as tickets to the tournament soar to astronomical prices.

item.title: Audio of Austin Appelbee's incredible Triple Zero call after marathon swim to save family
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: PM condemns 'white supremacy ideology' behind alleged Invasion Day terror attack
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has condemned the "racism and hatred" and "white supremacy ideology" behind the alleged terrorist attack on the Invasion Day rally in Borloo/Perth last month.

item.title: Lando Norris quickest on day one of F1 preseason test, Oscar Piastri drives well and Max Verstappen impresses
item.description: McLaren's Formula 1 world champion Lando Norris was fastest on the first day of preseason testing in Bahrain, but Max Verstappen and Red Bull caught the attention with pace and plenty of laps.

item.title: Baker Boy talks new album Djandjay, Riverboats festival and family legacy
item.description: The Yolŋu artist known as the Fresh Prince of Arnhem Land is the king of feel-good bilingual bangers. But heavy is the crown.

item.title: Labor releases audio of Liberal MP backtracking on $495 million cost of living policy at industry event
item.description: South Australia's Treasurer says the Liberal Party has secretly dumped its major $495 million policy less than six weeks out from the state election, with the Opposition arguing it has to wind back Labor's tax due to state budget blowouts.

item.title: Liberals' leadership machinations dominate the political week
item.description: The Liberals have spent the week embroiled in leadership woes as the party braces for a spill on Friday morning.

item.title: New video shows violent arrest of Australian filmmaker James Ricketson at Sydney's anti-Herzog protest
item.description: New video obtained by ABC NEWS Verify shows in vivid detail the arrest of a 76-year-old man, who was later released without charge.

item.title: Men face drug cultivation charges after $10 million cannabis bust in Victoria's north
item.description: Police allege a drug bust in Victoria's north-west has uncovered 10 large grow houses cultivating $10 million worth of illegal cannabis.

item.title: More than 100 Stolen Generations survivors gather for apology anniversary
item.description: More than 100 Stolen Generations survivors have gathered in Canberra for the apology anniversary. The government is pledging new money to help them heal.

item.title: Max Verstappen critical of new Formula 1 cars as preseason testing continues
item.description: Four-time Formula 1 world champion Max Verstappen says the 2026 cars are "not so fun", claiming the increasing energy management demands on drivers are "just not Formula 1".

item.title: Keen to declutter this year? Here's how to start
item.description: Experts say you don't need to pull out the entire contents of a cupboard, beginning with one bag is best.

item.title: Former Tottenham manager Ange Postecoglou says Spurs 'not a big club' in wake of Thomas Frank sacking
item.description: Tottenham Hotspur are "not a big club" because of their policy in the transfer market, former manager Ange Postecoglou has said in the wake of the London club's sacking of head coach Thomas Frank on Wednesday.

item.title: Ley leaves Taylor an immediate electoral test with Farrer by-election
item.description: Within two hours of being elected Liberal leader, Angus Taylor has already been delivered his first big electoral test, and it has come from the woman he deposed.

item.title: AFL Origin 2026: Are footy fans still keen on interstate football?
item.description: After a break of more than a quarter of a century, AFL State of Origin returns in Perth tomorrow with a battle between two proud football states, Western Australia and Victoria.

item.title: Bald Archy satirical art prize highlights political victories, a murder trial and protest movements
item.description: From the trial of Erin Patterson to the landslide election victory, 2025 is pilloried in this year's satirical art prize, the Bald Archy.

item.title: Maugean skate's endangered status not changing, Environment Minister Murray Watt says
item.description: Environment Minister Murray Watt says his decision to keep the status of a rare Tasmanian skate species as endangered rather than change it to critically endangered is based on scientific advice.

item.title: Drug vessel MV Raider heading towards Sydney after being stripped of cocaine
item.description: A ship caught carrying five tonnes of cocaine is making its way towards Sydney after being stripped of its cargo.

item.title: Australia in danger of World Cup elimination after 'unbelievable' loss to Zimbabwe
item.description: Australia's hopes of advancing out of Group B are dealt an almighty blow as Zimbabwe claims one of the biggest upset wins in T20 World Cup history in Colombo.

item.title: Sydney children's author Oliver Phommavanh jailed for sending sexually explicit messages to minors
item.description: Oliver Phommavanh is sentenced to six-and-a-half years in prison with a non-parole period of four years.

item.title: From Japan to Israel, elections are reshaping global politics
item.description: At a time when so much of the global conversation is about the rapid decline of democracy, it is striking what a huge impact elections are having on world events just now.

item.title: Michael Mohammed Ahmad confronts traumatic childhood abuse in his new novel, Bugger
item.description: Michael Mohammed Ahmad, author of The Lebs, marks turning 40 with the publication of his most confronting novel yet.

item.title: Chickens help autistic teen Summer Farrelly make sense of humans
item.description: While growing up, people didn't make much sense to Summer, but chickens always did. Now, Summer is using what they learnt to help other children with autism understand human interactions.

item.title: What chickens can teach us about socialising.

item.title: Easy, tasty and nutritious recipes for sharing this Ramadan
item.description: Looking for easy, nutritious Ramadan recipes? These options will help you prepare for and break your fast well.

item.title: Solo diver recounts brush with mako sharks off Tasmanian coast
item.description: Phillip Ellis Wells was solo diving roughly 7 kilometres off the east coast of Tasmania when he noticed a shadow pass overhead.

item.title: Innovative cattle loading ramp puts animal welfare at centre of design
item.description: A retired truck driver has developed a wide, steel, cattle-loading ramp that allows animals to walk side by side, mimicking natural herd behaviour and reducing noise, agitation and the risk of injury during transport.

item.title: Oscar Piastri raises safety concerns ahead of F1 Australian Grand Prix
item.description: Oscar Piastri has raised concerns about safety issues at the upcoming Australian Grand Prix, worried about potential chaos at the very start of the F1 season opener.

item.title: Two women die in crash after police pursuit in Sydney's south-west as critical incident declared
item.description: NSW Police say they pursued a red sedan after it had been stolen from a petrol station in South Hurstville and its owner allegedly assaulted.

item.title: Easy ways to help protect your hair from chlorine and saltwater damage
item.description: Regular beach days or laps at the local pool can leave our hair looking and feeling quite different.

item.title: AFL State of Origin coaches hail success of concept following Victoria's win over Western Australia
item.description: Winning Victoria coach Chris Scott and his Western Australia counterpart Dean Cox call for State of Origin to be played every year after the concept's stunning return in Perth.

item.title: Townsville marathon swimmer crosses Cook Strait between NZ's South and North islands
item.description: Swimming in shark-infested waters across one of the most treacherous island crossings in the world was a challenge Townsville woman Liz Denyer could not pass up.

item.title: City of Melbourne quiet on plan for Southbank's 'ugly' red stairs, long after design competition announced
item.description: A Melbourne council unveiled a lucrative competition to replace Southbank's much-derided red stairs. But a year after it was due to start, the plan appears to have gone nowhere.

item.title: Australia defeated by India in opening T20 as Sophie Molineux era gets off to wobbly start
item.description: Australia slumps to a rain-affected 21-run loss to India in their opening T20 at the SCG, after selectors opted to drop vice-captain Tahlia McGrath.

item.title: Future of fishing prosecutions unclear after multi-million-dollar abalone trafficking case collapses
item.description: Subpoenaed documents obtained by the ABC reveal NSW Police continued prosecuting seven men for illegally trafficking abalone despite advice that their case was likely to fail.

item.title: Traditional owners 'won't accept' handback of rehabilitated Argyle diamond mine site
item.description: East Kimberley traditional owners are concerned Rio Tinto's closure plan will leave them with "a giant hole in the ground forever".

item.title: Antarctic type B killer whales seen for first time near WA's Bremer Bay
item.description: Sightings of Antarctic orcas in Australian waters are very rare. A tour group in WA saw what appeared to be a pod of Antarctic type B killer whales muscle in and steal the meal of a local group of orcas.

item.title: Maugean skate still faces 'catastrophic' risk from salmon farming, Commonwealth advice says
item.description: Official advice is unequivocal that salmon farming remains the main threat to the endangered Maugean skate. It remains to be seen if the federal environment minister will ask Tasmanian salmon farms to scale back their operations.

item.title: 'Devastated' Australia on the brink of World Cup exit after Sri Lanka's record chase
item.description: Australia is on the cusp of a group stage exit from the T20 World Cup after crashing to an eight-wicket loss against tournament co-hosts Sri Lanka.

item.title: Robert Duvall, star of The Godfather and Apocalypse Now, dies at 95
item.description: Oscar winner Robert Duvall, known for films such as The Godfather and Apocalypse Now, has died at the age of 95.

item.title: Results show high levels of lead contamination in dust around Hobart, as EPA flags further tests
item.description: High levels of lead contamination have been found in dust samples taken from suburban locations close to Nyrstar's Hobart zinc smelter, documents obtained by the ABC show.

item.title: Tasmanian Motor Accident Insurance Board suing Melissa Oates for $934k in damages over Jari Wise's death
item.description: A woman who hit and killed her partner with her car in 2020 is being pursued for almost $1 million in damages by the Tasmanian Motor Accident Insurance Board.

item.title: Juanella Donovan reflects on People's Choice win at National Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art Awards
item.description: Juanella Donovan has taken out the People's Choice category at the National Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art Awards for the second time, emerging as the public favourite from more than 200 entries across the country.

item.title: Own goal ends Macclesfield's FA Cup fairytale against Brentford
item.description: Non-league English football club Macclesfield's tremendous FA Cup run has come to an end, falling to Premier League side Brentford.

item.title: Pod Save America and why Australians remain obssessed with US politics
item.description: Huge crowds have flocked to live shows for the popular and influential Pod Save America podcast, suggesting Australia's obsession with US politics isn't going away anytime soon.

item.title: Australian production company Matchbox Pictures to be closed by Universal International Studios
item.description: Matchbox Pictures, the local production house behind Dog Park, The Survivors and Secret City, will be closed by its international parent company, Universal International Studios.

item.title: Sydney’s great fatberg hiding in the sewers
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: ABC to move Adelaide office to new Tapangka site in CBD, alongside arts organisations
item.description: The ABC has announced a new location for its Adelaide operations, moving to a new arts and media hub alongside other government arts organisation in the CBD.

item.title: Aussie teen forced to wait for Olympic final as heavy snow wreaks havoc
item.description: Australia's Ally Hickman has to wait another day for the women's snowboard slopestyle final, as a snowstorm hits Livigno and causes scheduling delays.

item.title: Jesse Jackson, civil rights leader and US presidential hopeful, dead at 84
item.description: The two-time Democratic presidential hopeful remembered for powerful speeches died peacefully surrounded by loved ones, his family said.

item.title: Aerials delay is not unusual, as snow causes chaos at Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics
item.description: Delays are nothing new in skiing events, with weather and light a constant battle for event organisers. However, the Australian aerials team has an unusual method to handle the disruption.

item.title: Telstra accused of environmental breaches in culturally-significant area in SA national park
item.description: Sources say the actions will likely affect Aboriginal communities and that the investigation was not shared with the public.

item.title: Real Madrid star Vinícius Júnior says Benfica's Gianluca Prestianni racially abused him in Champions League match
item.description: Real Madrid forward Vinícius Júnior accuses an opponent of racially abusing him during a Champions League game against Benfica, leading to the game being halted for nearly 10 minutes.

item.title: Legends slam Australia's 'not surprising' T20 World Cup crash out
item.description: For the first time since 2009, Australia won't advance from the group stage of a cricket World Cup and some of the game's greatest ever players are demanding answers.

item.title: Jesse Jackson helped lay the groundwork for Barack Obama and kept the fight for justice in the public eye
item.description: Reverend Jesse Jackson, who died on Tuesday aged 84, leaves behind a towering legacy in politics and the fight for justice in the United States and abroad.

item.title: Ex-Macarthur FC captain Ulises Dávila fined $11k over A-League card fixing saga
item.description: Former Macarthur FC captain Ulises Dávila avoids jail time over his involvement in a card fixing scandal.

item.title: More delays for Winter Olympics as 'severe' weather approaches
item.description: Milano Cortina organisers have been forced to postpone the men's aerials event, featuring Australian Reilly Flanagan, due to another forecast of inclement weather.

item.title: Driver charged over Camden fatal crash escaped Cumberland Hospital mental health care before incident
item.description: A driver charged over a double-fatal crash used a staff pass to escape hospital the day before an alleged Sydney stabber fled the same mental health facility.

item.title: Tasmanian EPA drops plan to implement tighter lead controls after pushback from Nyrstar smelter
item.description: Three years ago, Tasmania's environment watchdog proposed to tighten lead emission limits from Hobart's zinc smelter to bring the state into line with national standards — but after pushback from the operator, that plan was dropped.

item.title: Quiz: Which books are these literary quotes from?
item.description: Are you happiest with your nose in a book? Did you spend summer reading at the beach? This quiz is for you.

item.title: Danielle Scott's Winter Olympic silver ends years of pain
item.description: In this most tension-filled Winter Olympic sport, it's no wonder tears are a by-product of both success and failure. Thankfully for Dani Scott, this time she was crying tears of pure joy.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Dog invades cross-country skiing, Americans get engaged as Ally Hickman feels the pain — day 12 quick hits
item.description: A pair of US athletes announce their engagement as Ally Hickman's medal bid turns sour and a dog steals the show at the cross-country skiing. Here are the quick hits from day 12 at the Winter Olympics.

item.title: M1 reopened after truck carrying 10,000 litres of molasses crashes
item.description: The M1 motorway reopens following an hours-long clean-up operation after a truck carrying 10,000 litres of molasses rolled during a crash, leaving two drivers with serious injuries.

item.title: Brisbane's Lang Park concert cap almost doubles under new trial
item.description: A one-year trial will see the number of concerts at Brisbane's Lang Park almost double from 12 to 21 per year.

item.title: How exclusion orders could ban Australian citizens from returning home indefinitely
item.description: One of the Australian women being held in a Syrian refugee camp has been barred from returning home after being given a temporary exclusion order — but the ban may not be as temporary as the name implies.

item.title: SA secures Australian MotoGP, world-first street circuit announced
item.description: The South Australian government has confirmed the Australian MotoGP will move to Adelaide from 2027, bringing with it huge economic benefits, but the opposition and Greens say the state has other priorities.

item.title: What is Skimo? The sport preparing to steal the show at the Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympic Games
item.description: Skimo, or ski mountaineering, is coming to the 2026 Winter Olympics. But what is the sport and why is it so exciting?

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026 quick guide: What to watch on Day 13
item.description: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan.

item.title: Rottnest Channel Swim organisers weigh cancellation as 55 kph winds forecast
item.description: As thousands of people prepare to tackle Western Australia's iconic Rottnest Island Swim, rough weather is threatening to grind it to a halt just 48 hours before it begins.

item.title: American star completes comeback with figure skating gold after 'retiring' at 16
item.description: Alysa Liu becomes the first American woman to win singles figure skating gold in 24 years, completing her comeback after retiring in 2022 when she was only 16 years old.

item.title: Abandoned Antarctic base is now a pollution threat
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Michael Brian Becton sentenced to more than 24 years in jail for child sex offences
item.description: Michael Brian Becton, 33, is handed a 24-and-a-half year prison term after pleading guilty to 77 child sexual offences against children and babies. WARNING: This story contains details that some readers may find distressing.

item.title: What we know about ex-prince Andrew's arrest on suspicion of misconduct in public office
item.description: Police are searching two addresses in the UK, including Royal Lodge on the Windsor Estate where the former prince lived until last year.

item.title: Calls for protection of Tasmania's penguins amid reports of birds 'handled by the neck'
item.description: Each summer, tourists flock to Tasmanian beaches to marvel at penguins, but for some, admiring the birds from afar is not enough.

item.title: Police guarding former prince Andrew's residence in Sandringham
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Voters divided as Barnaby Joyce considers contesting New England for One Nation
item.description: One Nation MP Barnaby Joyce says he might recontest his seat of New England as a candidate for One Nation if the party needs him to.

item.title: Car driving Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor leaves UK police station.
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Amyl and the Sniffers singer in escalating legal battle with photographer
item.description: What began as a photo shoot with champagne, ice cream and humorous glamour shots of Amy Taylor, singer from punk band Amyl and the Sniffers, has escalated into a legal fight over copyright, the US Constitution and an application for a restraining order.

item.title: Coalition willing to help stop passports for IS-linked women— as it happened
item.description: Angus Taylor says the Coalition is willing to help the government strengthen legislation so women with ties to Islamic State are not issued Australian passports.

item.title: Major US fund's credit squeeze could 'blow up' — as it happened
item.description: Shares in US asset manager Blue Owl have fallen sharply after it announced it was having challenges meeting investors' cash demands.

item.title: Donald Trump says Andrew's arrest is a 'shame' for Royal family
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: JD Vance laments Eileen Gu's choice and Scotty James channels Wolf of Wall Street — day 13 quick hits
item.description: Scotty James says he is not done, while Sweden claims the entire curling world is "against us". Here are the quick hits from day 13 at the Winter Olympics.

item.title: NT hit-and-run driver Jake Danby's sentence extended on appeal, as victim's family say they feel 'broken'
item.description: The sentence of NT hit-and-run driver Jake Danby has been extended on appeal, meaning he will serve two years in home detention. Danby hit two pedestrians with his car in June 2024, killing one.

item.title: NT cattle sector backs draft buffel grass plan as environmental and Aboriginal groups say it favours industry
item.description: Cattle producers support the NT's draft buffel grass weed management plan, but it has attracted criticism from traditional owners and environmental groups.

item.title: Eric Dane, star of Grey's Anatomy and Euphoria, dies aged 53
item.description: The star was best known for his role as Dr Mark Sloan in long-running medical drama Grey's Anatomy, and as the patriarch of the Jacobs family in teen hit Euphoria.

item.title: WA councils could make laws to stop cats roaming under proposed state legislation
item.description: The WA government announces plans to give local councils the power to require cats to be contained to owners' properties, to protect native birds and other wildlife.

item.title: Cameron William Leslie Clark, accused of Easts Leagues Club stabbing, appears in court
item.description: Cameron William Leslie Clark is accused of repeatedly stabbing a 20-year-old female employee of the Easts Leagues Club in Coorparoo last Thursday night.

item.title: Senior Constable Stuart Parsonage charged with illegal surveillance by WA Police sex crime division
item.description: Geraldton Senior Constable Stuart Parsonage has been charged with the illegal installation of a surveillance device and unlawful use of a computer by WA sex crime detectives.

item.title: Mercedes F1 boss Toto Wolff defends team over engine drama ahead of Australian Grand Prix
item.description: Toto Wolff accuses rival Formula 1 manufacturers of ganging up on Mercedes to pressure the governing FIA to change engine rules, but says it will make no difference.

item.title: Coroner delivers findings into James Tsindos's death from allergic reaction to delivery meal
item.description: A Victorian coroner hands down her findings into the death of a teenager who suffered a severe allergic reaction to a delivery meal — but it's unclear if more urgent treatment would have saved his life.

item.title: Scientists model best-case and worst-case climate scenarios for Antarctica
item.description: Scientists say parts of Antarctica face "devastating" and "irreversible" impacts from climate change unless urgent action is taken to limit greenhouse gas emissions.

item.title: Woman who fatally struck 12-year-old Marshall Oakley-Stagg granted restricted driver's licence
item.description: A driver who struck and killed a 12-year-old boy outside his school in southern Tasmania in 2024 has been granted a restricted licence.

item.title: Newcastle man avoids jail for child abuse images and bestiality videos
item.description: A man has avoided time behind bars and instead been handed a three-year community corrections order for possessing 34,000 child abuse images and more than a dozen bestiality videos.

item.title: New Zealand man Tamaohungia Joseph Tepatu-Edwards jailed for 26 years for attempted cocaine importation
item.description: A man who tried to smuggle more than 800 kilograms of cocaine into WA – and was only caught when his boat broke down — will spend two decades in jail and is "likely" be deported.

item.title: Norway sets Winter Olympics record with 17th gold medal
item.description: Norway breaks its own record for the most gold medals won by a nation at a single Winter Olympics.

item.title: Putin is betting Ukraine and the West run out of resources first
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin is betting that the West and Ukraine will run out of resources first.

item.title: Andy Griffiths, author of the Treehouse books, named new Australian Children's Laureate
item.description: Famous for writing stories about toilets and tree houses, the bestselling kids' author is taking on a new challenge on the national stage.

item.title: ABC 50/50 quiz: This week we're testing your knowledge of Ninja Turtles, Netflix and nagging pain
item.description: Every question has only two options: One is right and the other is wrong. You have an even chance of guessing correctly each time.

item.title: The art and origins of the courtroom sketch
item.description: They're a small and curious cohort in a line of work rapidly evolving. Welcome to the world of courtroom artists.

item.title: Peter Malinauskas is heading for a landslide win in SA. How crushing a victory will it be?
item.description: Even if it's a Labor landslide, we'll learn a lot from next month's South Australian election, writes Casey Briggs.

item.title: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor's arrest shows money talks louder than women's testimony
item.description: Why is an email about the trade trip apparently more compelling than the detailed and painful evidence of a woman?

item.title: Farmer's hands-off approach creates unusual lamb with distinct flavour chefs say is like nothing else in Australia
item.description: When Frank was forced to sell the sheep he'd been farming for more than 20 years, something had to change. His "experiment" is helping expats feel at home.

item.title: Queensland woman wakes from coma after contracting meningitis and septic shock on ski holiday to Japan
item.description: When 24-year-old Anna Gallo woke up shivering in a Tokyo hotel, she thought it was food poisoning. Hours later, she was in a coma fighting for her life against a disease she thought she was vaccinated against.

item.title: North Queensland on high alert as deluge continues and rivers rise
item.description: Flooding is likely to become more widespread in northern and western Queensland over the next few days, with further heavy rainfall and road closures expected.

item.title: Daly River flood evacuees to return home after more than two weeks in Darwin
item.description: After spending more than a fortnight sleeping at a Darwin evacuation centre 220 kilometres away from their flooded community, bus loads of Daly River locals are set to return home.

item.title: Vulnerable flatback turtle numbers stabilise thanks to Mackay community action
item.description: Local conservation groups have worked to protect turtle nesting habitats along the Mackay coast for more than 30 years, bringing generational change for these "ancient mariners".

item.title: Why economists hate low unemployment for inflation
item.description: The theory goes that if you have just the right amount of workers on the unemployment scrap heap, you can keep inflation in check. The problem is that no-one knows exactly what the magic unemployment rate is.

item.title: Two teenage boys killed in fatal car crash at Crabtree, in Tasmania's Huon Valley
item.description: Flowers have been laid for two teenage boys who died in a single vehicle crash in Tasmania's Huon valley overnight, with three others taken to hospital.

item.title: Women and children in Syrian camp "will end up in Australia" | Insiders On Background
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Balinese women find shared culture and community in WA's Pilbara
item.description: The Pilbara is known for spinifex and mining, but has also become a melting pot of cultures from across the globe.

item.title: I had a miscarriage over the summer. It was nothing like I expected
item.description: My understanding of miscarriage was built on a handful of Hollywood representations and snatches of stories I'd read. Outside of this, I had few reference points.

item.title: A 'return to craft' for the NT's award-winning young artists showcased at this year's Exit Art
item.description: Almost a dozen high school-aged artists have received awards as part of a prestigious Northern Territory showcase, with a number of finalists exhibiting self-portraits.

item.title: Anna Murdoch-Mann, author and ex-wife of Rupert Murdoch, dies aged 81
item.description: The author, journalist and philanthropist was Rupert Murdoch's "active partner" in his media empire News Corp over their 31-year marriage.

item.title: NASA boss blasts Boeing and agency over bungled test flight that left astronauts stranded on space station
item.description: A bungled Boeing mission that left two astronauts stranded on the International Space Station for nine months has been criticised by NASA's new boss.

item.title: South Australian election countdown officially begins, campaign kicks off
item.description: Election campaigning in South Australia is officially underway, with candidates seizing the opportunity to begin making their formal pitches to voters before they head to the ballot box in March.
